name: calculate_rates
description:
It's not uncommon that you want to give your customer the choice between whether they want to ship the fastest, cheapest, or the most trusted route. Most companies don't solely ship things using a single shipping option;
so we provide functionality to show you all your options!

calculate_tax_amount.description: Calculate the duties and tariffs for cross border shipments.

carrier_ids.description: Array of carrier ids to get rates for

is_return.description: Indicate if it's a return shipment

se_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies a ShipEngine resource, such as a carrier, label, shipment, etc.
se_id.title: se_id

currency.description: The currencies that are supported by ShipEngine are the ones that specified by ISO 4217: https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html
currency.title: currency

shipment_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the shipment

partial_shipment.description: The information necessary to ship a package, such as the origin, the destination, the carrier service, and the package dimensions and weight.

advanced_options.description: Advanced shipment options.  These are entirely optional.

carrier_id.description: The carrier account that is billed for the shipping charges

confirmation.description: The type of delivery confirmation that is required for this shipment.

created_at.description: The date and time that the shipment was created in ShipEngine.

customs.description: Customs information.  This is usually only needed for international shipments.

external_order_id.description: ID that the Order Source assigned

external_shipment_id.description:
A unique user-defined key to identify a shipment.  This can be used to retrieve the shipment.

> **Warning:** The `external_shipment_id` is limited to 50 characters. Any additional characters will be truncated.

insurance_provider.description: The insurance provider to use for any insured packages in the shipment.

is_return.description: An optional indicator if the shipment is intended to be a return. Defaults to false if not provided.

items.description:
Describe the packages included in this shipment as related to potential metadata that was imported from
external order sources

modified_at.description: The date and time that the shipment was created or last modified.

origin_type.description: Indicates if the package will be picked up or dropped off by the carrier

packages.description:
The packages in the shipment.

> **Note:** Some carriers only allow one package per shipment.  If you attempt to create a multi-package shipment for a carrier that doesn't allow it, an error will be returned.

return_to.description: The return address for this shipment.  Defaults to the `ship_from` address.

service_code.description: The [carrier service](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/use-a-carrier-service/) used to ship the package, such as `fedex_ground`, `usps_first_class_mail`, `flat_rate_envelope`, etc.

ship_date.description: The date that the shipment was (or will be) shippped.  ShipEngine will take the day of week into consideration. For example, if the carrier does not operate on Sundays, then a package that would have shipped on Sunday will ship on Monday instead.

ship_from.description: The shipment's origin address. If you frequently ship from the same location, consider [creating a warehouse](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/reference/create-warehouse/).  Then you can simply specify the `warehouse_id` rather than the complete address each time.

shipment_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the shipment

shipment_number.description:
A non-unique user-defined number used to identify a shipment.  If undefined, this will match the external_shipment_id of the shipment.

> **Warning:** The `shipment_number` is limited to 50 characters. Any additional characters will be truncated.

shipment_status.description: The current status of the shipment

tags.description: Arbitrary tags associated with this shipment.  Tags can be used to categorize shipments, and shipments can be queried by their tags.

total_weight.description: The combined weight of all packages in the shipment

warehouse_id.description: The [warehouse](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/ship-from-a-warehouse/) that the shipment is being shipped from.  Either `warehouse_id` or `ship_from` must be specified.

partial_shipment.title: partial_shipment

bill_to_account.description: This field is used to [bill shipping costs to a third party](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/bill-to-third-party/).  This field must be used in conjunction with the `bill_to_country_code`, `bill_to_party`, and `bill_to_postal_code` fields.

bill_to_country_code.description: The two-letter [ISO 3166-1 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) of the third-party that is responsible for shipping costs.

bill_to_party.description: Indicates whether to bill shipping costs to the recipient or to a third-party.  When billing to a third-party, the `bill_to_account`, `bill_to_country_code`, and `bill_to_postal_code` fields must also be set.

bill_to_postal_code.description: The postal code of the third-party that is responsible for shipping costs.

contains_alcohol.description: Indicates that the shipment contains alcohol.

custom_field1.description: An arbitrary field that can be used to store information about the shipment.

custom_field2.description: An arbitrary field that can be used to store information about the shipment.

custom_field3.description: An arbitrary field that can be used to store information about the shipment.

delivered_duty_paid.description: Indicates that the shipper is paying the international delivery duties for this shipment.  This option is supported by UPS, FedEx, and DHL Express.

dry_ice.description: Indicates if the shipment contain dry ice

dry_ice_weight.description: The weight of the dry ice in the shipment

fedex_freight.description: Provide details for the Fedex freight service

freight_class.description: The National Motor Freight Traffic Association [freight class](http://www.nmfta.org/pages/nmfc?AspxAutoDetectCookieSupport=1), such as "77.5", "110", or "250".

non_machinable.description: Indicates that the package cannot be processed automatically because it is too large or irregularly shaped. This is primarily for USPS shipments.  See [Section 1.2 of the USPS parcel standards](https://pe.usps.com/text/dmm300/101.htm#ep1047495) for details.

saturday_delivery.description: Enables Saturday delivery, if supported by the carrier.

third_party_consignee.description: Third Party Consignee option is a value-added service that allows the shipper to supply goods without commercial invoices being attached

use_ups_ground_freight_pricing.description: Whether to use [UPS Ground Freight pricing](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/ups-ground-freight/).  If enabled, then a `freight_class` must also be specified.

bill_to_party.description: The possible bill to party values
bill_to_party.title: bill_to_party

collect_on_delivery.description: Defer payment until package is delivered, instead of when it is ordered.
collect_on_delivery.title: collect_on_delivery

collect_on_delivery_payment_type.description: Types of payment that are supported
collect_on_delivery_payment_type.title: collect_on_delivery_payment_type

value.description: The weight, in the specified unit

origin_type.description: Indicates if the package will be picked up or dropped off by the carrier
origin_type.title: origin_type

date_time.description: An [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) string that represents a date and time.
date_time.title: date_time

international_shipment_options.description: Options for international shipments, such as customs declarations.

contents.description: The type of contents in this shipment.  This may impact import duties or customs treatment.

customs_items.description: Customs declarations for each item in the shipment.

non_delivery.description: Indicates what to do if a package is unable to be delivered.

international_shipment_options.title: international_shipment_options

customs_item.description: The customs declaration for a single item in the shipment.

country_of_origin.description: The two-letter [ISO 3166-1 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) where this item originated

customs_item_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the customs item

quantity.description: The quantity of this item in the shipment.

sku.description: The SKU (Stock Keeping Unit) of the customs item

sku_description.description: Description of the Custom Item's SKU

value.description: The declared customs value of each item

customs_item.title: customs_item

monetary_value.description: A monetary value, such as the price of a shipping label, the insured value of a package, or an account balance.

amount.description: The monetary amount, in the specified currency.

monetary_value.title: monetary_value

quantity.description: The quantity of this item included in the shipment

order_source_name.description: The order sources that are supported by ShipEngine
order_source_name.title: order_source_name

content_description.description: A short description of the package content. Required for shipments moving to, from, and through Mexico.

form_download.description: The form download for any customs that are needed

insured_value.description: The insured value of the package.  Requires the `insurance_provider` field of the shipment to be set.

label_download.description: The label download for the package

package_code.description: The [package type](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/reference/list-carrier-packages/), such as `thick_envelope`, `small_flat_rate_box`, `large_package`, etc.  The code `package` indicates a custom or unknown package type.

package_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this [package type](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/reference/list-carrier-packages/)

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the package.  The format depends on the carrier.

height.description: The length of the package, in the specified unit

length.description: The length of the package, in the specified unit

width.description: The width of the package, in the specified unit

dimension_unit.description: The dimension units that are supported by ShipEngine.
dimension_unit.title: dimension_unit

optional_link.description: A link to a related resource, or an empty object if there is no resource to link to

href.description: The URL of the linked resource, if any

type.description: The type of resource, or the type of relationship to the parent resource

optional_link.title: optional_link

label_download.description: Reference to the various downloadable file formats for the generated label

href.description: The URL of the linked resource, if any

pdf.description: The URL for the pdf generated label

png.description: The URL for the png generated label

zpl.description: The URL for the zpl generated label

label_download.title: label_download

label_messages.description:
Custom messages to print on the shipping label for the package.  These are typically used to print invoice numbers, product numbers, or other internal reference numbers.  Not all carriers support label messages. The number of lines and the maximum length of each line also varies by carrier.

|Carrier            |Max lines |Max line length
|-------------------|----------|--------------------
|USPS (Stamps.com)  |3         |60
|FedEx              |3         |35 for the first line. 30 for additional lines.
|UPS                |2         |35
|OnTrac             |2         |25

reference1.description: The first line of the custom label message.  Some carriers may prefix this line with something like "REF", "Reference", "Trx Ref No.", etc.

reference2.description: The second line of the custom label message.  Some carriers may prefix this line with something like "INV", "Reference 2", "Trx Ref No.", etc.

reference3.description: The third line of the custom label message.  Some carriers may prefix this line with something like "PO", "Reference 3", etc.

label_messages.title: label_messages

package_code.description: A [package type](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/reference/list-carrier-packages/), such as `thick_envelope`, `small_flat_rate_box`, `large_package`, etc.  Use the code `package` for custom or unknown package types.
package_code.title: package_code

tracking_number.description: A tracking number for a package. The format depends on the carrier.
tracking_number.title: tracking_number

address.description:
Any residential or business mailing address, anywhere in the world.

> **Note:** Either `name` or `company_name` must be set. Both may be specified, if relevant.
address.title: address

partial_address.description: A complete or partial mailing address.

address_line1.description: The first line of the street address.  For some addresses, this may be the only line.  Other addresses may require 2 or 3 lines.

address_line2.description: The second line of the street address.  For some addresses, this line may not be needed.

address_line3.description: The third line of the street address.  For some addresses, this line may not be needed.

address_residential_indicator.description: Indicates whether this is a residential address.

city_locality.description: The name of the city or locality

company_name.description: If this is a business address, then the company name should be specified here.

name.description: The name of a contact person at this address.  This field may be set instead of - or in addition to - the `company_name` field.

phone.description: The phone number of a contact person at this address.  The format of this phone number varies depending on the country.

state_province.description: The state or province.  For some countries (including the U.S.) only abbreviations are allowed.  Other countries allow the full name or abbreviation.

partial_address.title: partial_address

address_residential_indicator.description: Indicates whether an address is residential.
address_residential_indicator.title: address_residential_indicator

partial_shipping_address.description: A complete or partial mailing address.

instructions.description: Additional text about how to handle the shipment at this address.

partial_shipping_address.title: partial_shipping_address

date.description: An [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) string that represents a date, but not a specific time.  The value _may_ contain a time component, but it will be set to `00:00:00` UTC by ShipEngine.
date.title: date

tag.description: Tags are arbitrary strings that you can use to categorize shipments.  For example, you may want to use tags to distinguish between domestic and international shipments, or between insured and uninsured shipments.  Or maybe you want to create a tag for each of your customers so you can easily retrieve every shipment for a customer.
tag.title: tag

issuing_authority.description: The authority that issued this tax. This must be a valid 2 character ISO 3166 Alpha 2 country code.

identifier_type.description:
Determines how FedEx will pickup your packages

|Pickup Type    | Description
|---------------|-----------------------------------------
|`vat`          | The tax identifier is a Value Added Tax.
|`eori`         | The tax identifier is an Economic Operators Registration and Identification Number (EORI).
|`ssn`          | The tax identifier is a Social Security Number.
|`ein`          | The tax identifier is an Employer Identification Number (EIN).
|`tin`          | The tax identifier is a Tax Identification Number (TIN).
|`ioss`         | The tax identifier is an Import One-Stop Shop (IOSS).
|`pan`          | The tax identifier is a Permanent Account Number (PAN).
|`voec`         | The tax identifier is a Norwegian VAT On E-Commerce(VOEC).
identifier_type.title: identifier_type

taxable_entity_type.description:
The taxable entity type for this tax item. Valid values include the following

|Value       |Description
|:---------  |:-----------------------------------------------------
|`shipper`   | The shipper is responsible for this tax.
|`recipient` | The recipient of the shipment is responsible for this tax.
taxable_entity_type.title: taxable_entity_type

$block: The information necessary to ship a package, such as the origin, the destination, the carrier service, and the package dimensions and weight.

$ul: **advanced_options**: Advanced shipment options

**bill_to_account**: This field is used to [bill shipping costs to a third party](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/bill-to-third-party/).  This field must be used in conjunction with the `bill_to_country_code`, `bill_to_party`, and `bill_to_postal_code` fields. (default: null)
**bill_to_country_code**: The two-letter [ISO 3166-1 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) of the third-party that is responsible for shipping costs. (default: null)

**bill_to_party**: Indicates whether to bill shipping costs to the recipient or to a third-party.  When billing to a third-party, the `bill_to_account`, `bill_to_country_code`, and `bill_to_postal_code` fields must also be set. (default: null)
**bill_to_postal_code**: The postal code of the third-party that is responsible for shipping costs. (default: null)
**collect_on_delivery**: Defer payment until package is delivered, instead of when it is ordered.
**payment_amount**
**amount**
**currency**
**payment_type**
**contains_alcohol**: Indicates that the shipment contains alcohol. (default: false)
**custom_field1**: An arbitrary field that can be used to store information about the shipment. (default: null)
**custom_field2**: An arbitrary field that can be used to store information about the shipment. (default: null)
**custom_field3**: An arbitrary field that can be used to store information about the shipment. (default: null)
**delivered_duty_paid**: Indicates that the shipper is paying the international delivery duties for this shipment.  This option is supported by UPS, FedEx, and DHL Express. (default: false)
**dry_ice**: Indicates if the shipment contain dry ice (default: false)
**dry_ice_weight**: The weight of a package
**unit**
**value**: The weight, in the specified unit
**fedex_freight**: Provide details for the Fedex freight service
**booking_confirmation**
**shipper_load_and_count**
**freight_class**: The National Motor Freight Traffic Association [freight class](http://www.nmfta.org/pages/nmfc?AspxAutoDetectCookieSupport=1), such as "77.5", "110", or "250". (default: null)

**non_machinable**: Indicates that the package cannot be processed automatically because it is too large or irregularly shaped. This is primarily for USPS shipments.  See [Section 1.2 of the USPS parcel standards](https://pe.usps.com/text/dmm300/101.htm#ep1047495) for details. (default: false)
**origin_type** (default: null)
**saturday_delivery**: Enables Saturday delivery, if supported by the carrier. (default: false)
**shipper_release** (default: null)
**third_party_consignee**: Third Party Consignee option is a value-added service that allows the shipper to supply goods without commercial invoices being attached (default: false)

**use_ups_ground_freight_pricing**: Whether to use [UPS Ground Freight pricing](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/ups-ground-freight/).  If enabled, then a `freight_class` must also be specified. (default: null)
**carrier_id**: The carrier account that is billed for the shipping charges
**confirmation**: The type of delivery confirmation that is required for this shipment. (default: none)
**created_at**: The date and time that the shipment was created in ShipEngine.
**customs**: Options for international shipments, such as customs declarations.
**contents**: The type of contents in this shipment.  This may impact import duties or customs treatment. (default: merchandise)
**customs_items**: Customs declarations for each item in the shipment. (default: )
**non_delivery**: Indicates what to do if a package is unable to be delivered. (default: return_to_sender)
**external_order_id**: ID that the Order Source assigned
**external_shipment_id**: A unique user-defined key to identify a shipment.  This can be used to retrieve the shipment.
**insurance_provider**: The insurance provider to use for any insured packages in the shipment. (default: none)
**is_return**: An optional indicator if the shipment is intended to be a return. Defaults to false if not provided. (default: false)
**items**: Describe the packages included in this shipment as related to potential metadata that was imported from (default: )
**modified_at**: The date and time that the shipment was created or last modified.
**order_source_code**
**origin_type**: Indicates if the package will be picked up or dropped off by the carrier
**packages**: The packages in the shipment.
**return_to**: A complete or partial mailing address.
**address_line1**: The first line of the street address.  For some addresses, this may be the only line.  Other addresses may require 2 or 3 lines.
**address_line2**: The second line of the street address.  For some addresses, this line may not be needed.
**address_line3**: The third line of the street address.  For some addresses, this line may not be needed.
**address_residential_indicator**: Indicates whether this is a residential address. (default: unknown)
**city_locality**: The name of the city or locality
**company_name**: If this is a business address, then the company name should be specified here.
**country_code**: The two-letter [ISO 3166-1 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1)
**email**: Email for the address owner.
**name**: The name of a contact person at this address.  This field may be set instead of - or in addition to - the `company_name` field.
**phone**: The phone number of a contact person at this address.  The format of this phone number varies depending on the country.
**postal_code**
**state_province**: The state or province.  For some countries (including the U.S.) only abbreviations are allowed.  Other countries allow the full name or abbreviation.
**instructions**: Additional text about how to handle the shipment at this address.

**service_code**: The [carrier service](https://www.shipengine.com/docs/shipping/use-a-carrier-service/) used to ship the package, such as `fedex_ground`, `usps_first_class_mail`, `flat_rate_envelope`, etc.

**shipment_id**: A string that uniquely identifies the shipment
**shipment_number**: A non-unique user-defined number used to identify a shipment.  If undefined, this will match the external_shipment_id of the shipment.
**shipment_status**: The current status of the shipment (default: pending)
**tags**: Arbitrary tags associated with this shipment.  Tags can be used to categorize shipments, and shipments can be queried by their tags. (default: )
**tax_identifiers**
